description: From Latin venditatio, from venditare, venditatum (“to offer again and again for sale”), v. freq. of vendere. See vend.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The act of setting forth ostentatiously; a boastful display.
examples: And some, by a cunning protestation against all reading, and false venditation of their own naturals, think to divert the fagacity of their readers from themselves
